reviews.review_msg: Waste of my time.  Worship Giltrow and be fancy with a highlighter during her make work projects its easy sailing.
She is so enthusiastic and adorable. The class was super easy and there was relatively little work despite a few major projects. Participation helps too.

Michelle is a fun teacher and is very helpful.  She does a good job of answering the questions that we have in class, and always emails out a TO Do list for every week.  The main problem with the class is that there is so much homework, and it's 3 hours long.  But I can see how it will help me in the future.
At times disorganized but always very enthusiastic and eager to help
Totally disorganized & flakey.  I dreaded going to this class each week.  Just a slog through pointless make-work assignments.

She is somewhat eccentric and a little hard to undestand. My group misinterpreted her instructions for an assignment, but ended up getting a better grade and doing a play out of it! Also, go for the Harbour Centre class, its more laidback than her main campus classes (thats what she says) and to top it off, we went to a bar for our last class!!!

The class in and of itself is very helpful. Now Michele...yes borderline krazy, eccentric, odd, but she made the class so memorable. Late, disorganized, unclear sometimes, but very very funnie, odd/interesting sense of humour, lenient, very nice, friendly, and you're either laughing WITH her or AT h
This course would have been so boring if it weren't for the energy (bordering on insane)of a caffinated Michele each week.  Take this course with her...
Very unorganized.  Very flexible with deadlines.
Definately unclear marking scheme.  Not very organized either, but she's nice.
WONDERFUL!! interesting, pleasant, Enjoyable
Inspiring, enthusiastic, very knowledgeable and light-hearted.

I really enjoyed having her as a prof. She really emphasizes genre theory and analysis. This is NOT an introductory course so don't take this first year. There is a fair amount of writing in this course but she's very helpful and takes the time to go over things with you in class. Defs recommend her as an instructor!!
intro to academic writing? definitely not an intro. marlene does not make it any easier. if you are straight out of high school, prepare to struggle in this class.

Very nice professor. Marks fairly easy and is easy-going. If you're looking for a course to "enhance" your writing skills, this is not the right course. I was deceived. However it's a pretty laid back class. Marlene is awesome!

She is very kind and very approachable in office hours.  Although she was somewhat unclear in her assignment expectations, she presented the idea of "academic writing" to me in a way that I could understand.
One of the sweetest profs at SFU, I took this course 4 years ago and I still remember her kindness.

Daniel was the toughest grader I've encountered at sfu, and he left little feedback. I scored an 85 on an assignment, but it only had one note about a better word I could've used. I don't know where the rest of my grade went? This class is hard and boring, BUT it made me a much better writer. I feel like I understand academic writing now.

Daniel is a great Prof. He has clear instructions for his assignments and is reasonable when asking for help. He actually supports your learning and makes the class fun. The small class size is also nice. You do need to work hard on your assignments tho. You also have to pay attention in class or you won't understand the assignments.

English is really not my forte and not having clear criteria laid out makes this class super difficult for me. However, Daniel is an excellent lecturer and I learned a lot about academic writing from this class.
Hard but fun class. So much work you wont believe it but the actual seminars were fun to me.

Daniel Dunford is one of the best English professors at SFU. He is genuinely interested in the material and his lectures are never boring. In addition, his marking is fair and gives tons of feedback on assignments. Would definitely consider taking a course with him again in the future if I have the chance.
be prepared for lots and lots of completly useless writing..not the kinda of intro to writing class youd expect..okay prof but material is not so great
Dunford is an awesome professor. Very easy-going. He manages to make his English class interesting and enjoyable.
very nice guy, fair marker and funny. really enjoyed this course.
Stresses clarity on assignments, but is somewhat vague if you ask him questions regarding assignments.  Fair at marking, but lots of work in his class!
Organized and direct. Teaches well but the workload impressed upon the students is quite stressful.
Made the class fun... an ok teacher

Awesome Prof, I hate english, writing, and papers, and yet I was still able to pull an A- off through hard work with alot of her help.  Taking her course in my first year and first semester was probably one of the best choices I made at SFU, as she teaches you fundamentals of both reading and writing that peers in upper levels struggle with.

This professor is awesome! Don't give up the opportunity to be in her class. A lot of readings yes, but very friendly with marking. If you're struggling, you should go see her as she is very helpful. I got an A- with her and although you have to work for it, it is not impossible. A lot better then other english professors. Quizzes are straight forw
Pretty cool prof
No Comments
